result.execSummary:
The defendant Clark Allen Schaefer was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Strangulation and Suffocation [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.235(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: To all previously-imposed sentences.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or will discharge with outstanding financial obligations due, a civil judgment shall be entered for the balance due.

Complete domestic abuse counseling, complete psychological examination, follow all treatment if required. Maintain absolute sobriety.  Complete AODA and comply with all treatment recommendations. Submit DNA sample.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: filed by Attorney Michael Hughes
filed by Attorney Michael Hughes
filed by DA office

Defendant Clark Allen Schaefer in court, in custody from Dodge Correctional, with attorney Michael Hughes.  Jane E. Kohlwey appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Court went over the rights & elements. Defendant pled no contest to count 1. Court found defendant guilty, entered judgment, sentence: 6 yr. confinement imposed: 3 yr. prison, 3 yr. Extended Supervision, consecutive to all previously-imposed sentences. Court stayed sentence, placed defendant on 3 yrs. probation, consecutive to present sentence, conds: complete domestic abuse counseling, complete psychological examination, follow all treatment if required. Maintain absolute sobriety.  Complete AODA and comply with all treatment recommendations. Submit DNA sample. $618 costs. Cts. 2-5 read in and dismissed.  No jail credit.

Defendant, Clark Allen Schaefer, appeared in custody, with Atty. Amanda Riek. Clifford Chase Burdon appeared for the State of Wisconsin. $1,500 cash bond with felony conds. and no contact M.S., her residence or workplace, 3rd party contact allowed for defendant to obtain his glasses. DNA swab to be taken. Time limits not waived.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 8, 2015 at 09:00 am.
